intro: Pouzolzia gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are arranged in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Pouzolzia gardneri is adapted to dry environments and is often found growing in rocky soils and along canyon walls.
